Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I tried both ways for gaming in linux

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
In the end I had to pass through GPU to win10... While this is 100x better than having to reboot, and also means that with a good enough computer you can run Linux VMS for other things and games at the same time, it also means u need 2 GPUs. My vega64 is not avalibe in Linux it only works when I boot the windows VM. 
Some games work natively, but I can't play them because my GPU is disabled on Linux... I guess a better way is using a Vega for Linux and a 1080ti for the windows VM, but it all gets very expensive hardware wise to set up.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This paper from 2017 seems to say that Zcash did not pick the (n,k) = (200,9) optimally, that with a new technique called "index pointers", the running-time becomes independent of k, if I understand correctly: http://sci-hub.tw/10.1145/3140649.3140652#

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, the link looks shady, but it's sci-hub legit link

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: TLDR is still pretty long

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is almost 100% why BEAM chose (150,5) and why Zcash is following them, mostly because "BEAM did it"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the paper also slaps the hand of Equihash, basically saying it assumes it's built on the strength of a well-known math problem, but because they slightly modified things, it's actually not. It could be in a much simpler "complexity class"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now there are appliance ASIC for it along with nicehash, it seems a decent enough PoW

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c they "pay their respects" in the article, say that it is a good PoW for many applications

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it could be that in the future, a very large speedup is found for Equihash, is what I take away from reading it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Equihash told everybody "we rely on the hardness of the generalized birthday problem", but that is wrong

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so you can't assume all the math that studied that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: nobody knows how "easy" equihash might be found to be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: regardless, NN will get 75% of blocks, even if hashrate goes up 100x overnight

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am not too worried, this is theoretical

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: big O() notation doesn't take into account constants that we, in reality, care about

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it might be that people will prove that this new stuff, that equihash is based on, is as "hard" as the generalized birthday problem. But nobody has yet. Math people care about that stuff üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the paper is from Nov 2017, so it's not anything new. But Daira mentioned it, when deciding on new (N,K) params, and I found it interesting
